title: Platonic to start!
text:
Friends first; lets get to know each other!!

I am looking to make new friends. Any good relationship starts out as friends first and in due time can evolve into a meaningful relationship. Someone who just wants to have a good time without pressure, be yourself and I will do the same. Personally I am an easy going, laid back can be funny as hell, very sarcastic and like to laugh rarely get stressed or become angry. I will make fun of you as well of myself. Life is short so I just like to enjoy the days as they go by. I will at times do random acts of kindness to others just to make myself feel better and to make our world a better place for all. As to what I like to do the laundry list can go on and on, but will try almost anything once. Some of the things I enjoy most are trying new restaurants (ethnic ones with a green B in the window) road trips speeding to our destination, the outdoors and cooking and yes I am a good cook. Quiet moments together just enjoying the company of one and other; lets not forget acting our shoe size not our age.

One thing that is very important to me is that you are an honest and real, a kind and caring person who speaks the truth. Someone who has feelings and is not afraid to express then, help each other out in both times of good and bad.I don't care what you do fore work or where you live or what you drive, just be a good hearted and a real person that hard to find this city we call home. Ideally I am looking for someone who is a least 35.

What I would like to get out of this post, is to make some new friends and maybe just maybe a best friend and a lover. Someone to grow old and grey and tooth-less with and have medacare buy us a pare of Hoverrounds.


If you have read everything I have written great. Because there is so much spam or BS on these listings I will only reply back if you answer a few basic questions in no particular order.

Where do you live, a zip code will work. Just want to make shore were both in the same time zone?

What decade where you born in?

Should I be a monkey suite or jeans and tee shirt person?

Are you just as happy eating at an ethnic restaurant with a green B in the window as you might be at a fine dining restaurant?

In all fairness hear are my answers to my questions.

Nine oo three 5

Turbulent 60's

Jeans and tee

Green B ethnic

title: Looking for a friend to chat with and maybe more
text:
Life is too short to waste it, so finding a friend is my goal, to share special moments and conversations, which may become endearing, captivating, adventurous and downright fun.
I want something deeper than just superficial intimacy. I want to connect on a level so few have had the privilege to achieve with that special friend. Finding someone to chat and share everyday things, talking about our life's journey and all the choices we've made good or bad. 
I don't know why certain people are placed in front of your path, coincidences, fate or sheer happenstance but nevertheless, everyone I have come into contact with have been cherished and beloved memories. Are you the one this post was meant for, I sure hope you are, I know you're out there? Age to me is just a number to me, I hope it holds no real significance for you either. I am able to relate to you whether your 21 or 55, having the confidence in my ability to engage in great conversations with you.
I dare you to find out if I'm what is needed, to help get you through a boring day. Remember we all need someone in our life's from time to time to make us feel alive.

If you genuinely want to talk about the important things in life - love, relationships, parenting, careers, faith, and others ... all those good things that make life worth living - then we should get along very well.

Maybe also talk about the joys or challenges we face -- in marriage or just life; how we are being stretched, possibly overwhelmed, how we have overcome, or how we are being overtaken ... with grief, with fear, with loss.

title: Human contact / cuddling
text:
This may sound like a very strange request, but I'm looking for a fit / attractive person who wants to cuddle, or hang out together in close proximity. 

Watch a movie, have a couple drinks, conversation (or no talking) and just relax. No expectations no pressure. Nothing sexual at all - really. I just miss human contact without it being in any way about sex. 

I'm settling back into LA after a couple years overseas. I work long hours with a very demanding job, and I don't have much of a social circle - and don't feel comfortable turning to a friend for this.

title: Your Personal Shopping Buddy - A Man's Point of View
text:
Do you love shopping? Do you wish you had someone along on your shopping excursions for an honest and discerning opinion? You know quite well that a shop keeper and store clerk tell you what you want to hear in order to make the sale. That's where I come in. I'm there to tell you what works and what doesn't, from a man's perspective.

I have been doing this for decades, accompanying women of all ages through malls and boutique districts, giving that much needed man's point of view, with a discerning eye that has worked in fashion, photography, and film. I am not a personal shopper, I am a shopping buddy, your style consultant there to help you look your best, give an honest opinion, and perhaps even save you money - because you know you have clothes in your closet with the tags still on that you will never, ever wear.

My rate is $125 an hour, and I will be that patient shopping friend you've been looking for.

Bonus - Relationship advice from that coveted guy's perspective is included.

If interested, please email your contact information, shopping plans; when and where, and send a photo of yourself in the mirror with the words "Shopping buddy" written on your hand for verification.

Thank you for your interest, and good shopping to you.

I do not have a place to live yet, I am looking to stay near a beach area from Redondo Beach to Malibu, as long as it is near the beach. I can pay you $1,000 a month or $2500 up-front for three months June 1- August 31, 2016.

I would also like you to be similar in manners and also to practice English with me if your time permits.

I hope to hear something from a cool Californian!
Cheers!

Happy Internation womens day

Well that being said If you guys have a kik and decide to answer you guys can reach my kik at jondoe297.
And you guys answer via email please put your favorite character as the subject, a bit about yourself an a picture would hurt. I am not shallow but would like to know who I am talking to. In return to your generosity I will also send a picture.

Haha thank you for your time reading this and hope to hear from you soon.

title: We all need someone to talk to, maybe feel alive again.
text:
I was wondering if there were still persons out there that miss writing to someone. I understand that in today's society time is more valuable. So I won't take up too much of your time, what I am looking for is a woman to write to, get to know. If we have a human connection then we can text and talk on the phone. 

Do you have the imagination and the desire to engage in what may be some of the most interesting and tantalizing conversation you have had in a while? Let's explore the world of words put in such a way that brings images to mind that feel so real, so vivid and floods all your senses. 

I miss having my phone make that beautiful noise of notifying me that I have a message, text or email, how my heart races and my breath quickens in that split second when I look down and see your name, giving me another reason for carrying my phone. 

I don't mind if you're married, in a relationship or single, just have a beautiful personality, great outlook on life and not be hung up on looks or age. I am not here to promise or pretend to be something I'm not, I'm just a man that seeks a connection with a special someone, that's all. I am married, so this would only be for friendship.

I shall do my best to captivate your mind and excite your synapses, igniting a flurry of electrical and chemical sensations within your brain and maybe, just maybe some wonderful memories.

title: Are you lonely, looking for a friend, or need some assistance?
text:
Do you ever find yourself lonely, bored, needing help with starting basic tasks/chores, some simple motivation, assistance with finishing or getting projects started, want someone to watch TV shows with, or accompany you to the movies, go hiking, have breakfast/lunch/dinners with, or simply just being there for you as a friend?

Then look no further, I am that ideal person you have been searching for, here to help you fill the void in your life.

I can be there for you as a friend, listen to your problems, help you shop, style you, give you motivation, assist you with challenging tasks, give you clarity, exercise with you, help you with meals (and dieting), give you advice, help boost your self-esteem, organize your goals and schedules. . .pretty much anything. But most of all, I will be there for you as a friend.

I also specialize in helping people with special issues, such as: addiction (have worked as sober companion), depression, and anxiety.

I have privately helped a roster of clients throughout the years. Ranging from discrete elite, to middle-class individuals - all walks of life. Each person I have worked with has been unique in their own way, but one thing they all had in common was their positive feedback they shared with me, about how I was such a supportive encouragement in their lives. Many have said I helped them survive their darkest times, and have left them with a new outlook on life. Whether it was only a few months or several years, my friendship to them helped encourage them and brought positive change to their lives.

I am a young guy, in my late 20's, living near the West Hollywood area. I have degrees in psychology and counseling, with years of experience working with a wide variety of individuals.
I am very chill/laid-back, easy to talk to, thoughtful, empathetic, compassionate, and considerate person. I take great joy/fulfillment in helping others, by being a genuine friend. I know life is tough, and sometimes it may seem like no one is really there to care or help, but I am. It is my goal to make your life easier, help you smile/laugh, give you entertainment, something to look forward to, but most importantly, to be your friend. I am also great with pets too.

If I sound like someone that could be of help to you, please contact me and we will set up a meeting. My rates are very affordable, but can vary. I typically charge around $25 an hour, but under certain circumstances, adjustments can be made. 

I look forward to helping you!

title: Hiking anyone?
text:
Don't have a man in your life? Of course you don't otherwise you wouldn't be reading this. Tired of spending evenings and the weekends alone while your friends are with their boy friends or husbands? Don't have anyone to spend time with or cuddle up with under a blanket to watch a movie with? Tired of dating players or guys that don't want a relationship? Well maybe we can help each other. 

I am an up front honest guy. Very sincere, very loyal, and very loving. I'm 28. Tall, Dark, Handsome, and Educated. A woman doesn't have to have model looks for me to be attracted to her but she needs to be height/weight proportionate. 

I am a very monogamous man as I typically only even date one woman at a time let alone sleep with more then one woman. I am relationship oriented but am open to being casual. 

I am looking to find a special woman that I connect with on an emotional, intellectual, and physical level. Someone who is highly intelligent, active, and passionate as well as genuine and sincere. Someone who loves to make me feel like a man as much as I love to make her feel like a woman. 
Someone who believes in me, supports me, yet is honest with me because I am not perfect. The woman I find has always been out there, I just haven't been lucky enough to find her yet. Not only will we be passionate lovers and share a deep intimate connection, most importantly we will be best friends. She will be the last thing I see when I go to bed at night and the first thing I see when I wake in the morning. The question is, are you her?

Facebook.com/JeffAvenue23

title: French Certified Personal Trainer For Hire (Los Angeles)
text:
Bonjour! My name is Williams, I M A STRAIGHT PERSON AT 100%.
I am a certified personal trainer with 8 years of fitness experience in nutrition, training, sports and athleticism. I'm also a French international model signed to Wilhelmina Models LA, so staying healthy both physically and mentally has always been a strong part of my daily life.

I would like to utilise my expertise to help you set and achieve your fitness goals in order to better yourself - the way you look, the way you feel and the way you continue to live. Together, we will develop a workout routine that best suits your needs and then go from there...

I am a member of LA Fitness, so if you are too, we can easily have our sessions at this particular gym. However, if you have your own private gym or I will be more than happy to travel to your place I have all the stuff in my car to workout.

About MY RATE :
- is $80 for 1 session by each week and each session is 1h to 1.5 hours up to my clients :-)
- is $150 for 2 sessions by each week meaning $75 for each session
- is $200 for 3 sessions by each week meaning $66 for each session
- is $240 for 4 sessions by each week meaning $60 for each session
- is $280 for 5 sessions by each week meaning $56 for each session
My schedule is pretty flexible, so I can be available at your request for as many sessions as your fitness goals require.

If you are interested in my personal training services, please feel free to e-mail me with your contact information and I will be sure to respond as soon as possible. Serious inquiries only. I really look forward to working with you!

text:
What's up guys, I'm creating this post in hopes of connecting with some other like-minded individuals (or maybe not, if you want to debate with someone with differing perspectives i'm down) that are interested in general intellectual progressivism, but specifically participate in or are interested in the fields of or related to: Atheism, Anti-Theism, Anarchism, Anarcho-Syndicalism, Altruism/Selflessness, Existentialism, Existential Nihilism, Philosophy, Veganism, Human Rights, Animal Rights, (Actual) Feminism, Pacifism, Ecologism, Anti-Establishment/Corporatism/Capitalism, basic equality, and generally changing the way we see things... 
These are the main causes I can think of off the top of my head, so really people who are open-minded, kind, displeased with popular American/national outlook and sociopolitical norms, displeased with current political state, and interested in seeking truth and the best answers through reasoning and rational thinking.
People with philosophical ideas based in rationale and possibly pursuing writing on these subjects.
People that are focused in socialism, communism, Marxism and other forms of government and economic policy i'd like to talk to too. Especially cool if you have or plan on taking direct action to combat problems.

Not sure if craigslist is really the place to look for people like this lol, but it seems the only other places would be punk concerts and universities, which are both easily hit or miss situations... And vegan restaurants too would work. I guess.
I'm also interested in art: 2d, sculpture, music, film, street art, tagging. My favorite music genres are sludgecore, crust punk, powerviolence, anarcho-punk, doom metal, conscious and hardcore hip-hop, reggae, soul, indie and a lot more, genres related to these I probably like. Pretty depressed music and movies are my favorites: City of God, Gummo, Kids, gang movies. Emotional, meaningful art of all kinds I'd likely enjoy.

As of now I want to establish a base so maybe in the future, friendships, possibly art collectives, housing co-ops, or other stuff can bud from this... I honestly don't know... 
So, if you're interested in any of these things, hit me up at my cell, texting's cool but if you can't I'll probably answer a call. We could talk over text or online or meet in person. I live in the 562 area but I can probably travel. If you email me put CRAIGSLIST in the Subject please, my email is oversaturated with notifications.

title: I ain't nobody's bargain
text:
If you're reading this, perhaps the nature of the title drew you in. I will be upfront in that I'm not looking for anything other than genuine connection. Why I'm posting here, I can't exactly say. Maybe a bit optimistic? Maybe a bit crazy? Yeah, perhaps just the right amount of both.

I'm in my early 30s, and while I'm generally quite content and satisfied and (insert whatever bullshit positive-sounding adjective you want), I'm very much a restless soul at heart, but I keep that well hidden, I believe. I've had my ups, perhaps more than most, and I've had my downs, and quite frankly, I have no desire to reach out just for the sake of reaching out. I have zero interest in games and fluff. 

The more I type, the less inclined I am to to drone on and on. I feel like if you're even mildly interested to converse further at this point, you'll shoot me an email and we'll go from there. I'm no open book by any means, but what I am is genuine and fully disclosing to those who earn my trust. To get at least the tip of the inevitable superficialities outta the way, yes, I am active and do take care of myself (but yeah, of course the semi-regular porkout happens, more often than I'll admit in such a generic post, ya nosy bastard), so it'll probably be beneficial if you're of a somewhat similar ilk. No, I don't give a rat's ass about your race or age, as far as assigning "value."

Hope to hear from you if you're intrigued enough to start meaningful dialogue. Because ultimately, what the hell else is life even about?

title: Woman Seeking Others Who Had LASIK on Eyes
text:
Hi. Please read all of this ad before replying. I know this is an unusual ad. I'm a lesbian woman seeking friends. But I'm looking for others who have had LASIK or other similar types of eye surgeries. I have had both LASIK and PRK. My life went downhill since I had the surgeries many years ago. I find that I connect more with people who've had similar eye surgeries, so that's why I'm looking for this specific thing. You don't have to be someone who is unhappy with your LASIK results. I just find that I connect better with people who've had these eye procedures. Due to my eye issues, I don't drive. So I'd like to find someone who I can hang out with, go places with on the bus or Metrolink, like trying different restaurants, museums, amusement parks, gay bars. I live on my own and would also be nice to have a friend who could sometimes help when I have something heavy to lift at home. Although that doesn't happen too often.
A little about myself: I'm in my early 40s. I am more butch looking. I have short hair. I don't dye my hair or wear much make-up. I am half Mexican. I suffered some minor burns to the skin on my face a few years ago. But I don't look like I was burned, I just look like I"m a little older than my age. I mention this cause I'm insecure about it. I'm more of a shy person. I usually let the other person do most of the talking. I grew up attending religious private schools in the San Gabriel Valley. I love animals. I like to collect movies on VHS tape. I am very liberal in terms of my political views. I rarely drink and I don't smoke. It's OK if you drink or smoke, as long as you don't smoke around me.
What I'm looking for is a friend who is preferably between the ages of 37 and 47. Someone who is kind and non-judgmental. I don't like people who cuss a lot or people who are violent. You would have to be a guy who is OK with us just being friends, being I am gay. (To any perverts, please don't think that I will be into doing a threesome with you and another woman. I won't do that.) If you'd like to go with me to a gay bar that would be cool. That would be cool if you were also gay, but that's not a requirement. 
If you'd like to respond, please email me and I'll get back to you soon. Thanks!

title: Email penpals
text: I'm seeking a long-term email penpal with whom I can exchange at least one long email with once a day, sharing our innermost thoughts, feelings, ambitions, and desires. Sometimes we just need to talk and we have no one to talk to- well, let's be that person for each other. Everybody's lives are so unique and complicated and distinctly important to them- let's appreciate the lives of others, and entangle our lives together by the simple, therapeutic act of writing to each other. About me: I'm a college student studying in a science-related field who's suffered from social anxiety and depression on and off. Sometimes I find myself (like now) studying late at night, or early in the morning, and feeling really alone in this huge world. Each day is different, yet the same- I only feel truly happy when I notice life's simple and beautiful things, like a little hummingbird flying out of the lush green bushes or the deafening roar of thunder in the rare storm. Maybe our correspondence can be, in a sense, one of those simple and beautiful things.

title: Looking for nice Asian girl to see a movie with this week
text:
Hi how are all of you?
I hate going to the movies by myself. It sucks, and I really love the movies, so without anyone to talk to movies about, I find myself rather lonely and not enjoying them so much.
Okay, that was kind of depressing, so let me start over.
I am looking to just hang out as friends with a nice Asian girl and who would not mind to go see the movie Olympus Has Fallen with me. I know, it's a mindless man movie, but sometimes you just need to watch something that has zero importance and forget about reality for awhile. So if you would be interested in this, let me know and we can set it up for this week. Monday would be nice perhaps?
Oh, why Asian, you ask? No, I don't have yellow fever or a weird Asian fetish (gross to both those things!). I lived and worked in Asia for several years and most of my friends are Asian, so it's just a comfort thing for me at this point. Just am more in tune with Asian culture than others and I'd like to keep it that way. Make sense? I hope so. 

About me: Blond hair, blue eyes, I hope you won't think I'm ugly. I'm in my early 30's, college educated, run several businesses, and am an author and app maker. I do a LOT of different things in my life. When we get together, I don't care if you are married, dating, single, or whatever, because this honestly is just about friendship. I mean, sure, it would be nice to meet somebody, start off platonic, and be more later down the road, but that's so far removed from my thinking for a million reasons that you honestly have nothing to worry about with me. I'm just looking for great company.

So if you want an easygoing, polite and respectful white guy to go watch a silly movie with, message me and tell me about yourself. Maybe send a pic but it's not necessary because this isn't about how you look. I'm 5'7, so maybe if you are 6'2 that would matter, because then it would look like I'm your kid or something lol. But if you are Asian, you probably are either my size or more likely, shorter, so I guess that won't be a problem to be scene in public with each other in that regard. Not that I even care I guess, but you might?

Sorry, tangent. So yeah, message me and we'll go from there. If you are particularly awesome when we meet, the movie is my treat. And we should definitely get together before the movie to just break the ice and sit someplace and talk. Sound good? Hope to hear from somebody tonight or tomorrow!

title: Looking for a smart, funny girl to be my FWB! :)
text:
Hi CL!

After surfing this casual encounter section for the past few weeks now, I've decided to finally post!

To start off, I've noticed that there are a lot of "bots" and "spammers" on this website, so I'd like to let you know that I'm completely real. It's a Thursday, March 3rd, and I'm looking to meet up this weekend, preferably Saturday night.

About me -- I'm 21 years old, and currently a senior at one of the universities in Los Angeles. I was born and raised near San Gabriel, and grew up here in the city. I'm educated, smart, well-dressed, confident but not cocky, and funny. I love watching movies and TV shows, to playing video games, to reading books, to finding the best places to eat. 

While I'm looking for a FWB, I'd love to also find someone that I don't mind "grabbing a beer with." I'm 100% not looking for a relationship, but I would prefer that we get along intellectually and that we're able to have a conversation. I'm looking for someone who's not afraid of the "friend" in FWB, someone who's down to watch a movie or grab a cup of coffee on any given day.

Sexually, I'm pretty inexperienced. To be upfront, I've been with two people in my 21 years of life. I do prefer giving more than receiving, but that might be because I've never really experienced a great blowjob? Nonetheless, I love being between a girl's legs. Giving someone pleasure is definitely more fun than being on the receiving end.

Physically, I'm Asian, ~5'8, and athletic. From years of swimming, I've gained broad shoulders. I love to stay physically fit, and I do work out around 4 times per week. I don't smoke or do any drugs, drink recreationally, and have no weird piercings or tattoos. 

Ideally, you are older than 18 and fun to be around! I love people who are humorous and know how and when to crack a great joke. I'm attracted to women who are smart and confident, a la "lady in the street but a freak in the bed." I'm open to any race and any race. Please practice safe sex, and be disease free! 

Kink wise, I'm still pretty new to everything. I've mostly experienced "vanilla" sex, so I'm open to trying out new kinks. We can talk about this! :)

If you fit the above, I'd love to hear from you! Send me a message that describes who you are and what you're looking for. Want a quicker reply? Send me a photo!

Thanks for reading and I hope to hear from you soon :)

men. Men use the night to erase us. Stella Adler. We must not allow ourselves to be deflected by

24/7 while you work, eat, sleep, and interact with other men and women.

not know the difference. I am attracted to unusual, different, outspoken, creative women who think outside the box. Men are intimidated by you, and your sisters see you as a threat, and have or will
sabotage you for their benefit. "Normal women" who desire a family, children, and financial security
almost always have not worked for me. Regarding intimacy, the chances of that happening are less
than slim and none. We would have to connect on a spiritual, emotionally, physical and intellectual
level. I do not have dreams of a serious relationship. Also, my experience with women concerning

I see the world as a beautiful journey to explore-not the scary place the news portray. I laugh out loud 
daily, smiling to myself often, and enjoy being in natures wonder. Sure, I have had my bad times
but I am content with the present moment. I am a realist about the good and the bad. I have learned to
stay optimistic and have become an unconventional, universal thinker. I believe that if you live your 
life to your best alignment with your soul's purpose you can do no wrong and don't wish to harm other living creatures, all people included.

I will not judge if you smoke, take recreational drugs, or drink alcohol, as no one is a clean slate,
an enlightened being, or a saint. Most people cannot listen, or understand other people, even in their
70's. They are too distracted, numbed out by the media, and only focus on their immediate day-to-day
survival and dependent responsibilities. In this technology and fast paced world, I have somehow
learned to slow down, tune in and open my eyes. My spirit is no longer sleeping, rather it is like a 
vibrant child always seeking adventure and beauty. I am an adult and have responsibilities, but
freedom and wonderment have not ceased to exist. Also, I am average looking, and Google Kevin Spacey or Robin Williams for a facial. I have been told there is a close resemblance.

A woman isn't complete without a man. But where do you find a man these days? Lauren Bacall.

what McDonalds is to food. A plasticized version of the real thing. Kate Sofer I think, therefore I
am single. Elizabeth Cutler Many women, I think, resist feminism because it is an agony to be fully
conscious of the brutal misogyny which permeates culture, society, and all personal relationships.
Connie Frank. No woman is required to build the world by destroying herself. Isn't Julia Swift.
Isn't that the problem? That women have been swindled for centuries into substituting adornment for love, fashion (as it is) for passion. Jennifer Jayson.

title: Looking for hypnosis "guinea pigs"
text:

I have some hypnosis techniques that I'd like to refine. We'd start with an online hypnosis induction through a video I've created. So you'd start privately at home.

Age 18-28, gender or sexual preference is unimportant, windows computer with stereo headphones (speakers won't cut it), and an ability to focus well, and above all that you're genuinely interested in hypnosis and not a skeptic.

title: Having trouble finding new friends in Hollywood
text:
In my fourth year in LA I decided to move to Hollywood to try it out, but did not realize how infrequently I would see my friends in Santa Monica! I do fine socially after an introduction, but my social phobia is bad enough that I cannot just go meet people at bars or on the street. PhD in neurosciences seems to do that to people...makes us a little socially weird maybe? I wish I was better at it, but Craigslist has apartments, cars, exercise equipment, why not friends?

I would love to have a few friends close by to grab the occasional coffee or cocktail, roll our eyes at the tourists, or do goofy tourist events around for fun. I did the no-pants subway ride OMG that was hilarious. 

No idea who reads these, but I have had roommates from all walks of life and get along with most people well enough. Faster friends might be more curious about the world, geeks, maybe a little weird too, and value being kind to others. I am huge into running and lift at LA fitness too if those happen to be of interest, but they don't need to be. I also would love to start going to this Tuesday 9PM fire spinning thing near by...maybe you would do a class there?

I have enough of a media issue that I prefer not to post a picture of publicly. I'm not famous by any stretch, but I'll explain in person. Let's just say I have a very weird job!

title: NEED HELP getting PrEP for FREE?
text:
Interested in getting on PrEP for FREE? Free copays? or Free delivery? 

This is purely a free 1-on-1, confidential advice service, I offer guidance in navigating PrEP and HIV care. 

It doesn't matter whether you already have insurance, qualify for MediCal, or currently have nothing at all. I can guide most people into getting on PrEP (and getting it for free) with just a few short phone calls. I am also available to meet up in public locations for in-person consultations. 

Getting on PrEP is a very individual decision. I am not a doctor, however I am a healthcare professional with over 10 years experience working and volunteering in the HIV field. 

I will connect you with appropriate doctors and healthcare professionals who understand and respect your individual situation and lifestyle.

title: Successful writer/producer guy looking to meet smart, attractive gal
text:
I am a successful television writer/producer that lives and works in Los Angeles. Really.

And while that may sound good, working in the entertainment business comes with its setbacks. Long hours. An unpredictable schedule. And not many opportunities to meet new people, namely because socializing with the people I work with is a no-no.

So, that means finding a companion to go out and do things with is often not easy.

Right now, I'm hoping to meet someone fun, intelligent and attractive who can be a great activity partner. If more develops, cool. If not, that's okay too.

Here are some of the things I like to do: Attend live theater, concerts, film, and sporting events, travel, check out new restaurants, visit museums, and do various other activities, some related to the industry.

So, if you work in the biz, or at least have an interest in things regarding entertainment, that would be great. I am pretty well-versed in popular culture (film, music, theater), and if you aren't, you should be open to learning more from a great teacher. Or turning me on to new cool stuff, too.

One last thing: Even though I work in the business, but I'm not obsessed with it. I'm easily able to turn off my cell phone during a movie, concert or a show, and you should be too.

Now some details about me: I'm a single, never married, Caucasian male, that's 6' tall, about 185 pounds, clean-shaven, dark brown hair, deep blue eyes, 40-ish. I'm fit, well-toned, intelligent, able to converse on a wide variety of subjects, down to earth, casual and quick-witted.

About you: I'm open to meeting a woman of any race. It's all good. However, I'm most likely to be drawn to someone in their 20s or early 30s, on petite side, dark hair, thin, fit, in-shape.

We'll get along if you are independent, up on current events, able to make conversation, fun, and adventurous enough to be outgoing and try new things, but not necessarily a raging extrovert. Cool, quiet and demure works too.

And you should have a great sense of humor. At least good enough to be able to tell when I'm cracking wise, and laugh at the appropriate times.

Emails with pictures go to the head of the line.

AND THE CURE. and the list goes on, but enough about me, tell me about.... ME. Oh right this isn't a conversation, this is an introduction, duh dude, wake the fuck up. Seriously though, I'll turn no one away. If you're awake, lets talk.

I'm looking for a friend, or someone to talk to, with shared interests or COMPLETELY OPPOSITE interests.

email me, let's shoot the shit, tell some jokes, talk shit about all our best friends and then giggle as they walk by.

just kidding, you're more than welcome, but don't get jealous that I have better hair than you, and probably know more about female anatomy.

seeking a friend, an acquaintance, or whatever.

title: Seeking sanity, banter, fun, adventure
text:
Well not in any particular order actually, and yes I get I am posting on CL of all places.

I would like in free moments to have some fun and adventures in the real world, and welcome anyone with similar interests to maybe come along in your free moments too? I am single, would always be open to more if it develops, but have found most people seem to think everything is some sort of commitment instead of just enjoying the fun and adventurous moments. I choose to seek and enjoy any moment I can with positive people, as time is precious and hoping maybe can reach activity partners here.

Other times I have deadlines and commitments, and sometimes for hours into days, and I end up unwinding reading the CL posts for the great laugh out loud posts I seek. Sure sometimes I get educated, searching for the needle in the haystack or diamond in the rough.... but come on... we are mostly reading for the fabulous entertainment value at our fingertips right?

So I seek some sanity, some witty or intelligent banter, so I can make it through sometimes some very stressful moments. I have a brain, I have wit, and I know how to use it.

Am I going to send you to some site to sign up, or am I a guy...... No. It is just little ol' me on the other end of the screen. I am a white HWP 5' 8" female, and from birth too! So no need to worry or ask.

So if anyone has some free moments to share, let me know. You are here reading anyway right? While many are not adventurous enough to post, are you adventurous enough to respond? Hmmmmm....

title: A Peaceful Warrior
text:
My greatest gift of all is my ability to love a person so very deeply. I am talking about a kind of love that exists on all levels, beyond earthly emotions. I've realized that there aren't many people that will ever be able to feel or understand it. But(!) I know that you are out there. You've got to be, because I can't be the only one. Maybe not here on CL, but somewhere here on Earth.

My heart feels like as if it were a never ending ferocity, glowing inside of me and always telling me the sometimes illogical truth whether I want it or not. And I just can't help that I find discussions about existential ideas a lot more interesting than talking about people or events.

I appreciate aesthetic beauty in all its forms. But what really turns me on are things like kindness, courage, and intelligence(and not competence): attributes which I can see as clear as anything else but not with the physical eye. I am often alone but I never feel lonely. I've studied philosophy, but I'm not wise because of that. I speak different languages but my silence is louder than my words. 

These are things I've realized about myself in my time on this planet. Perhaps you feel the same way, or have realizations of your own. I keep the hope alive that somewhere out there is someone willing to say "hi" and take a chance.

title: Platonic to start!
text:
Friends first; lets get to know each other!!

Life is short so I just like to enjoy the days as they go by. I will at times do random acts of kindness to others just to make myself feel better and to make our world a better place for all. As to what I like to do the laundry list can go on and on, but will try almost anything once. Some of the things I enjoy most are trying new restaurants (ethnic ones with a green B in the window) road trips speeding to our destination, the outdoors and cooking and yes I am a good cook. Quiet moments together just enjoying the company of one and other; lets not forget acting our shoe size not our age.

One thing that is very important to me is that you are an honest and real, a kind and caring person who speaks the truth. Someone who has feelings and is not afraid to express then, help each other out in both times of good and bad.I don't care what you do fore work or where you live or what you drive, just be a good hearted and a real person that hard to find this city we call home. Ideally I am looking for someone who is a least 35.

What I would like to get out of this post, is to make some new friends and maybe just maybe a best friend and a lover. Someone to grow old and grey and tooth-less with and have medacare buy us a pare of Hoverrounds.

title: Traditional Jewish father figure sought
text:
I am a 48-year-old, 6ft, 150lb., straight, white male, who grew up in a Jewish household, but without my father in the picture, and without being part of or subject to a lot what is involved in raising a Jewish child, i.e. without a Tanakh in the household.

Over the years, I have found the fact of not having a father around has been a tremendous void, and is one that I am now seeking to fill.

Specifically, what I am looking for are weekly sessions, for however long that day that they would take, which would feature three parts:

1. TANAKH (GENERALLY WEEKLY TORAH & HAFTORAH PORTIONS) - We would read both in advance (I would read in English, as I only made it through 4 years of Hebrew school), and we would discuss the meanings, and specifically, the values that can be derived from each.

2. PERSONAL, FATHERLY ADVICE - I would present to you one to three issues that I have been having in my life, and you would provide your best fatherly advice on those issues, drawing on your life experience, Jewish law, or whatever other source you can bring to bear. I grew up without getting a lot of critical input that my father wasn't around to provide, so I am trying to make up for that.

3. DISCIPLINE - POTCH IN TUCHUS - Proverbs 10:17 provides that "He who follows discipline shows the way to life, but he who ignores reproof leads astray."--JPS Hebrew English Tanakh, 1999. 

In this phase of our meetings, I would present an issue or behavior which I have committed, for which I feel that I should be disciplined by my father. (I grew up without my father, and those that raised me chose not to spank me when I needed it, but many years ago, as a teen, or earlier, I recognized it would have been the right way to go for me, and would have helped me a great deal.)

Accordingly, after identifying the matter, I would present you with a razor strop, for your use; you, in turn, would tell me how many swats you thought I deserved, and if it was over 25, we would split it into sets. I would take that from you, face down on a bed, stripped to a jockstrap, and the hugs and comforting that would follow afterword, as you show your parental love for me . 

I know this type of accountability would have made a difference then, as I believe my real father would have done it to me, had he lived and stuck around to raise me -- and will now, with you serving in loco parentis. He was a proud Korean War vet, and must have been a tough guy, who would have commanded my unconditional respect fron a strap if it came to that.

Accordingly, if you are a Jewish male, age 48 on up, and are a traditional, old-school Jewish father figure or father, or believe you can fill that role on an ongoing basis, either once a week or once every two weeks, in sessions, please write with your age, stats, general location, experience, and your ability to host the sessions.

I know this is quite a lot to ask of one person, but if you feel you fit this bill, write me as I've requested above.

title: I get it. I really do.
text:
You've got questions.

Serious questions.

SUPER serious questions.

"What happened to a sense of wonder?"

"How do I rectify the natural human urge to make the world a better place with the reality of ultimately meaningless natural human obsessions?"

"What do I do when I realize being a grown up kind of sucks?"

"Where does this ennui come from?"

"Why is ennui such a funny word? It sounds like what a toddler would call his penis, an in-wee"

"Oh shit. Please stop thinking about that. The private parts of toddlers is never something that should be thought about, unless you're a pediatric urologist "

"Is pediatric urology a real field? Or are they just pediatricians or urologists?"

Yes, we all have questions. Just hopefully not about pediatric urology.

Oh, and I guess a Craigslist post would not be complete without a cock pic, so here you go:

title: Words of encouragement
text:
Recently I realized I want a career in law enforcement... :) Its so discouraging when I have friends or current co-workers ask about what I want in the future, I tell them that I'm working on getting into shape to go to the police academy and if I'm not getting a dirty look, I get a one word responses, or how much they hate this or hate that. I think it's pretty sad to see so many young people not even encouraging others who want to better a community they've been apart of their whole life, to make their world or maybe even their future kid's community a more safe place. Instead I get backlash.



I feel like I should just keep it a secret, but at the same time I'm so proud of myself for getting this far, getting over the intimidation of all the what ifs and working towards something so great. 



I guest I'm just looking for like minded people or a few words of encouragement, its always nice to read some supporting words while I'm working hard towards something so big.

Well I'm not sure how far I will get with this because for some people it's always about sex and not the actually nature of the ad. So here goes...what's up! I'm looking for a serious workout partner! I do work at a gym and I had some trainers but due to a little financial situation I had to stop, but I still need to hit the gym or just basically exercise on a regular...but it's hard to stay motivated on the real, so I was hoping if I had some one to workout with it would make it easier. I work 3rd shift so ideally someone that would be available in the afternoons or even early evenings or so would be great. If you have to do mornings that will be fine, I will just have to bring my workout clothes along with me. You don't have to be in the best shape of course but at least look as if though you've seen the inside of a gym or weights or something. I have a few workout plans and dvds but to have that push would be great as well. Anyway hit me up if you are interested and tell me your goals as well. If you have a group of friends that would like to join or that you work out with, that would be great since we can all motivate each other. 

Thank you

Thanks!

The complete historical subjugation of women to men must be rated as one of the most fantastic myths ever created by the human mind. Gilda Ratcliff Men are nervous of remarkable women.
Jane Fall. Feminism is a socialist, anti-family political movement that encourages women to leave
their husbands, kill their children, practice witchcraft, destroy capitalism, and become lesbians.
Pat Robertson-right wing Christian evangelist. A woman reading Playboy feels like a Jew reading a
Nazi manual. Gloria Steinem. The more famous and powerful I get, the more power I have to hurt
men. Men use the night to erase us. Stella Adler. We must not allow ourselves to be deflected by
feminists who are anxious to force us to regard the sexes as completely equal in portion and worth.
Sigmund Freud

your hair, listening with pleasure while you beg for more. The bad news is you don't believe me.

kill you. This conspiracy is validated by all organized religion, government, corporations, customs,

beautiful involving makeup, polished nails, sexy lingerie, and other adornments. It is on your mind
24/7 while you work, eat, sleep, and interact with other men and women.

There is a special place in hell for women who do not help other women. Madeline Albright. Women
should not be enlightened or educated. they should, in fact, be segregated as they are the cause of
hideous and involuntary erections in holy men. St. Augustine, Christian minister.Women are all 
female impersonators to some degree. Susan Brownmiller

I only seek a radical feminist, not a socialist or liberal feminist. Ninety seven percent of women do
not know the difference. I am attracted to unusual, different, outspoken, creative women who think outside the box. Men are intimidated by you, and your sisters see you as a threat, and have or will
sabotage you for their benefit. "Normal women" who desire a family, children, and financial security
almost always have not worked for me. Regarding intimacy, the chances of that happening are less
than slim and none. We would have to connect on a spiritual, emotionally, physical and intellectual
level. I do not have dreams of a serious relationship. Also, my experience with women concerning 
sex is they see it as a chore, and studies have shown that seventy percent would choose chocolate
or shopping if given a choice. A dinner, cultural event, and stimulating conversation would be ok
with me. If you do respond put radical feminist so I know you are not a robot.

I see the world as a beautiful journey to explore-not the scary place the news portray. I laugh out loud 
daily, smiling to myself often, and enjoy being in natures wonder. Sure, I have had my bad times
but I am content with the present moment. I am a realist about the good and the bad. I have learned to
stay optimistic and have become an unconventional, universal thinker. I believe that if you live your 
life to your best alignment with your soul's purpose you can do no wrong and don't wish to harm other living creatures, all people included.

I will not judge if you smoke, take recreational drugs, or drink alcohol, as no one is a clean slate,
an enlightened being, or a saint. Most people cannot listen, or understand other people, even in their
70's. They are too distracted, numbed out by the media, and only focus on their immediate day-to-day
survival and dependent responsibilities. In this technology and fast paced world, I have somehow
learned to slow down, tune in and open my eyes. My spirit is no longer sleeping, rather it is like a 
vibrant child always seeking adventure and beauty. I am an adult and have responsibilities, but
freedom and wonderment have not ceased to exist. Also, I am average looking, and Google Kevin Spacey or Robin Williams for a facial. I have been told there is a close resemblance.

A woman isn't complete without a man. But where do you find a man these days? Lauren Bacall.
We can't destroy the inequities between men and women until we destroy marriage. Robin Morgan.
Men often admit other women are oppressed, but not you. Emily Logan. Pornography is to sex what
what McDonalds is to food. A plasticized version of the real thing. Kate Sofer I think, therefore I
am single. Elizabeth Cutler Many women, I think, resist feminism because it is an agony to be fully
conscious of the brutal misogyny which permeates culture, society, and all personal relationships.
Connie Frank. No woman is required to build the world by destroying herself. Isn't Julia Swift.
Isn't that the problem? That women have been swindled for centuries into substituting adornment for love, fashion (as it is) for passion. Jennifer Jayson.

title: Platonic to start!
text:
Friends first; lets get to know each other!!

I am looking to make new friends. Any good relationship starts out as friends first and in due time can evolve into a meaningful relationship. Someone who just wants to have a good time without pressure, be yourself and I will do the same. Personally I am an easy going, laid back can be funny as hell, very sarcastic and like to laugh rarely get stressed or become angry. I will make fun of you as well of myself. Life is short so I just like to enjoy the days as they go by. I will at times do random acts of kindness to others just to make myself feel better and to make our world a better place for all. As to what I like to do the laundry list can go on and on, but will try almost anything once. Some of the things I enjoy most are trying new restaurants (ethnic ones with a green B in the window) road trips speeding to our destination, the outdoors and cooking and yes I am a good cook. Quiet moments together just enjoying the company of one and other; lets not forget acting our shoe size not our age.

One thing that is very important to me is that you are an honest and real, a kind and caring person who speaks the truth. Someone who has feelings and is not afraid to express then, help each other out in both times of good and bad.I don't care what you do fore work or where you live or what you drive, just be a good hearted and a real person that hard to find this city we call home. Ideally I am looking for someone who is a least 35.

What I would like to get out of this post, is to make some new friends and maybe just maybe a best friend and a lover. Someone to grow old and grey and tooth-less with and have medacare buy us a pare of Hoverrounds.


If you have read everything I have written great. Because there is so much spam or BS on these listings I will only reply back if you answer a few basic questions in no particular order.

Where do you live, a zip code will work. Just want to make shore were both in the same time zone?

What decade where you born in?

Should I be a monkey suite or jeans and tee shirt person?

Are you just as happy eating at an ethnic restaurant with a green B in the window as you might be at a fine dining restaurant?

In all fairness hear are my answers to my questions.

Nine oo three 5

Turbulent 60's

Jeans and tee

Green B ethnic

Bonjour! My name is Williams, and I am a certified personal trainer with 8 years of fitness experience in nutrition, training, sports and athleticism. I'm also a French international model signed to Wilhelmina Models LA, so staying healthy both physically and mentally has always been a strong part of my daily life.

I would like to utilise my expertise to help you set and achieve your fitness goals in order to better yourself - the way you look, the way you feel and the way you continue to live. Together, we will develop a workout routine that best suits your needs and then go from there...

I am a member of LA Fitness, so if you are too, we can easily have our sessions at this particular gym. However, if you have your own private gym or I will be more than happy to travel to your place I have all the stuff in my car to workout.

About MY RATE :
- is $80 for 1 session by each week and each session is 1h to 1.5 hours up to my clients :-)
- is $150 for 2 sessions by each week meaning $75 for each session
- is $200 for 3 sessions by each week meaning $66 for each session
- is $240 for 4 sessions by each week meaning $60 for each session
- is $280 for 5 sessions by each week meaning $56 for each session
My schedule is pretty flexible, so I can be available at your request for as many sessions as your fitness goals require.

If you are interested in my personal training services, please feel free to e-mail me with your contact information and I will be sure to respond as soon as possible. Serious inquiries only. I really look forward to working with you!

title: >>Any Cute Girls Want to Toke and Get Naked This Afternoon?
text:
Are there any cute girls (or women) -- of any legal age -- who might like to kick back this afternoon, have a toke, hang out, meet someone new, and sure, MAYBE even get naked, although that is not necessary? 

I'm a guy, basically easygoing, intelligent, even fun. I can even make you laugh -- whether with me or at me, who cares. I'm sure I could make you happy.

I'm fairly flexible about what we do, but generally just hang and yes, maybe get naked, although that is not required, just an idea to enhance things and get your attention. Maybe talk, or we can listen to music, or watch a video (I have several very good ones on hand), go for a walk in the park -- sure, any of that MAYBE naked (except the park, of course). Tell me your ideas, I'm open to whatever. I would simply enjoy the company, regardless of what we might do, and it doesn't have to be naked. Hey, maybe we even will make a new friend. Or more.

I'm older, middle age, so you have to be OK with that -- whether you're older, younger, it all works for me. Either way, even if an age difference, I'm sure you would be comfortable with me, I'm cool enough. We should trade pics when I hear from you; again, I think you will be satisfied.

title: Traditional Jewish father figure sought
text:
I am a 48-year-old, 6ft, 150lb., straight, white male, who grew up in a Jewish household, but without my father in the picture, and without being part of or subject to a lot what is involved in raising a Jewish child, i.e. without a Tanakh in the household.

Over the years, I have found the fact of not having a father around has been a tremendous void, and is one that I am now seeking to fill.

Specifically, what I am looking for are weekly sessions, for however long that day that they would take, which would feature three parts:

1. TANAKH (GENERALLY WEEKLY TORAH & HAFTORAH PORTIONS) - We would read both in advance (I would read in English, as I only made it through 4 years of Hebrew school), and we would discuss the meanings, and specifically, the values that can be derived from each.

2. PERSONAL, FATHERLY ADVICE - I would present to you one to three issues that I have been having in my life, and you would provide your best fatherly advice on those issues, drawing on your life experience, Jewish law, or whatever other source you can bring to bear. I grew up without getting a lot of critical input that my father wasn't around to provide, so I am trying to make up for that.

3. DISCIPLINE - POTCH IN TUCHUS - Proverbs 10:17 provides that "He who follows discipline shows the way to life, but he who ignores reproof leads astray."--JPS Hebrew English Tanakh, 1999. 

In this phase of our meetings, I would present an issue or behavior which I have committed, for which I feel that I should be disciplined by my father. (I grew up without my father, and those that raised me chose not to spank me when I needed it, but many years ago, as a teen, or earlier, I recognized it would have been the right way to go for me, and would have helped me a great deal.)

Accordingly, after identifying the matter, I would present you with a razor strop, for your use; you, in turn, would tell me how many swats you thought I deserved, and if it was over 25, we would split it into sets. I would take that from you, face down on a bed, stripped to a jockstrap, and the hugs and comforting that would follow afterword, as you show your parental love for me . 

I know this type of accountability would have made a difference then, as I believe my real father would have done it to me, had he lived and stuck around to raise me -- and will now, with you serving in loco parentis. He was a proud Korean War vet, and must have been a tough guy, who would have commanded my unconditional respect fron a strap if it came to that.

Accordingly, if you are a Jewish male, age 48 on up, and are a traditional, old-school Jewish father figure or father, or believe you can fill that role on an ongoing basis, either once a week or once every two weeks, in sessions, please write with your age, stats, general location, experience, and your ability to host the sessions.

I know this is quite a lot to ask of one person, but if you feel you fit this bill, write me as I've requested above.

title: I get it. I really do.
text:
You've got questions.

Serious questions.

SUPER serious questions.

"What happened to a sense of wonder?"

"How do I rectify the natural human urge to make the world a better place with the reality of ultimately meaningless natural human obsessions?"

"What do I do when I realize being a grown up kind of sucks?"

"Where does this ennui come from?"

"Why is ennui such a funny word? It sounds like what a toddler would call his penis, an in-wee"

"Oh shit. Please stop thinking about that. The private parts of toddlers is never something that should be thought about, unless you're a pediatric urologist "

"Is pediatric urology a real field? Or are they just pediatricians or urologists?"

Yes, we all have questions. Just hopefully not about pediatric urology.

Oh, and I guess a Craigslist post would not be complete without a cock pic, so here you go:

title: Words of encouragement
text:
Recently I realized I want a career in law enforcement... :) Its so discouraging when I have friends or current co-workers ask about what I want in the future, I tell them that I'm working on getting into shape to go to the police academy and if I'm not getting a dirty look, I get a one word responses, or how much they hate this or hate that. I think it's pretty sad to see so many young people not even encouraging others who want to better a community they've been apart of their whole life, to make their world or maybe even their future kid's community a more safe place. Instead I get backlash.



I feel like I should just keep it a secret, but at the same time I'm so proud of myself for getting this far, getting over the intimidation of all the what ifs and working towards something so great. 



I guest I'm just looking for like minded people or a few words of encouragement, its always nice to read some supporting words while I'm working hard towards something so big.

learned to slow down, tune in and open my eyes. My spirit is no longer sleeping, rather it is like a 
vibrant child always seeking adventure and beauty. I am an adult and have responsibilities, but
freedom and wonderment have not ceased to exist. Also, I am average looking, and Google Kevin Spacey or Robin Williams for a facial. I have been told there is a close resemblance.

A woman isn't complete without a man. But where do you find a man these days? Lauren Bacall.
We can't destroy the inequities between men and women until we destroy marriage. Robin Morgan.
Men often admit other women are oppressed, but not you. Emily Logan. Pornography is to sex what
what McDonalds is to food. A plasticized version of the real thing. Kate Sofer I think, therefore I
am single. Elizabeth Cutler Many women, I think, resist feminism because it is an agony to be fully
conscious of the brutal misogyny which permeates culture, society, and all personal relationships.
Connie Frank. No woman is required to build the world by destroying herself. Isn't Julia Swift.
Isn't that the problem? That women have been swindled for centuries into substituting adornment for love, fashion (as it is) for passion. Jennifer Jayson.

text:

I am looking to make new friends. Any good relationship starts out as friends first and in due time can evolve into a meaningful relationship. As to what I like to do the laundry list can go on and on, but will try almost anything once. Some of the things I enjoy most are trying new restaurants (ethnic ones with a green B in the window) road trips speeding to our destination, the outdoors and cooking and yes I am a good cook. Quiet moments together just enjoying the company of one and other; lets not forget acting our shoe size not our age.

One thing that is very important to me is that you are an honest and real, a kind and caring person who speaks the truth. Someone who has feelings and is not afraid to express then, help each other out in both times of good and bad.I don't care what you do fore work or where you live or what you drive, just be a good hearted and a real person that hard to find this city we call home. Ideally I am looking for someone who is a least 35.

What I would like to get out of this post, is to make some new friends and maybe just maybe a best friend and a lover. Someone to grow old and grey and tooth-less with and have medacare buy us a pare of Hoverrounds.

title: Traditional Jewish father figure sought
text:
I am a 48-year-old, 6ft, 150lb., straight, white male, who grew up in a Jewish household, but without my father in the picture, and without being part of or subject to a lot what is involved in raising a Jewish child, i.e. without a Tanakh in the household.

Over the years, I have found the fact of not having a father around has been a tremendous void, and is one that I am now seeking to fill.

Specifically, what I am looking for are weekly sessions, for however long that day that they would take, which would feature three parts:

1. TANAKH (GENERALLY WEEKLY TORAH & HAFTORAH PORTIONS) - We would read both in advance (I would read in English, as I only made it through 4 years of Hebrew school), and we would discuss the meanings, and specifically, the values that can be derived from each.

2. PERSONAL, FATHERLY ADVICE - I would present to you one to three issues that I have been having in my life, and you would provide your best fatherly advice on those issues, drawing on your life experience, Jewish law, or whatever other source you can bring to bear. I grew up without getting a lot of critical input that my father wasn't around to provide, so I am trying to make up for that.

3. DISCIPLINE - POTCH IN TUCHUS - Proverbs 10:17 provides that "He who follows discipline shows the way to life, but he who ignores reproof leads astray."--JPS Hebrew English Tanakh, 1999. 

In this phase of our meetings, I would present an issue or behavior which I have committed, for which I feel that I should be disciplined by my father. (I grew up without my father, and those that raised me chose not to spank me when I needed it, but many years ago, as a teen, or earlier, I recognized it would have been the right way to go for me, and would have helped me a great deal.)

Accordingly, after identifying the matter, I would present you with a razor strop, for your use; you, in turn, would tell me how many swats you thought I deserved, and if it was over 25, we would split it into sets. I would take that from you, face down on a bed, stripped to a jockstrap, and the hugs and comforting that would follow afterword, as you show your parental love for me . 

I know this type of accountability would have made a difference then, as I believe my real father would have done it to me, had he lived and stuck around to raise me -- and will now, with you serving in loco parentis. He was a proud Korean War vet, and must have been a tough guy, who would have commanded my unconditional respect fron a strap if it came to that.

Accordingly, if you are a Jewish male, age 48 on up, and are a traditional, old-school Jewish father figure or father, or believe you can fill that role on an ongoing basis, either once a week or once every two weeks, in sessions, please write with your age, stats, general location, experience, and your ability to host the sessions.

I know this is quite a lot to ask of one person, but if you feel you fit this bill, write me as I've requested above.

title: I get it. I really do.
text:
You've got questions.

Serious questions.

SUPER serious questions.

"What happened to a sense of wonder?"

"How do I rectify the natural human urge to make the world a better place with the reality of ultimately meaningless natural human obsessions?"

"What do I do when I realize being a grown up kind of sucks?"

"Where does this ennui come from?"

"Why is ennui such a funny word? It sounds like what a toddler would call his penis, an in-wee"

"Oh shit. Please stop thinking about that. The private parts of toddlers is never something that should be thought about, unless you're a pediatric urologist "

"Is pediatric urology a real field? Or are they just pediatricians or urologists?"

Yes, we all have questions. Just hopefully not about pediatric urology.

title: Words of encouragement
text:
Recently I realized I want a career in law enforcement... :) Its so discouraging when I have friends or current co-workers ask about what I want in the future, I tell them that I'm working on getting into shape to go to the police academy and if I'm not getting a dirty look, I get a one word responses, or how much they hate this or hate that. I think it's pretty sad to see so many young people not even encouraging others who want to better a community they've been apart of their whole life, to make their world or maybe even their future kid's community a more safe place. Instead I get backlash.



I feel like I should just keep it a secret, but at the same time I'm so proud of myself for getting this far, getting over the intimidation of all the what ifs and working towards something so great. 



I guest I'm just looking for like minded people or a few words of encouragement, its always nice to read some supporting words while I'm working hard towards something so big.

title: Traditional Jewish father figure sought
text:
I am a 48-year-old, 6ft, 150lb., straight, white male, who grew up in a Jewish household, but without my father in the picture, and without being part of or subject to a lot what is involved in raising a Jewish child, i.e. without a Tanakh in the household.

Over the years, I have found the fact of not having a father around has been a tremendous void, and is one that I am now seeking to fill.

Specifically, what I am looking for are weekly sessions, for however long that day that they would take, which would feature three parts:

1. TANAKH (GENERALLY WEEKLY TORAH & HAFTORAH PORTIONS) - We would read both in advance (I would read in English, as I only made it through 4 years of Hebrew school), and we would discuss the meanings, and specifically, the values that can be derived from each.

2. PERSONAL, FATHERLY ADVICE - I would present to you one to three issues that I have been having in my life, and you would provide your best fatherly advice on those issues, drawing on your life experience, Jewish law, or whatever other source you can bring to bear. I grew up without getting a lot of critical input that my father wasn't around to provide, so I am trying to make up for that.

3. DISCIPLINE - POTCH IN TUCHUS - Proverbs 10:17 provides that "He who follows discipline shows the way to life, but he who ignores reproof leads astray."--JPS Hebrew English Tanakh, 1999. 

In this phase of our meetings, I would present an issue or behavior which I have committed, for which I feel that I should be disciplined by my father. (I grew up without my father, and those that raised me chose not to spank me when I needed it, but many years ago, as a teen, or earlier, I recognized it would have been the right way to go for me, and would have helped me a great deal.)

Accordingly, after identifying the matter, I would present you with a razor strop, for your use; you, in turn, would tell me how many swats you thought I deserved, and if it was over 25, we would split it into sets. I would take that from you, face down on a bed, stripped to a jockstrap, and the hugs and comforting that would follow afterword, as you show your parental love for me . 

I know this type of accountability would have made a difference then, as I believe my real father would have done it to me, had he lived and stuck around to raise me -- and will now, with you serving in loco parentis. He was a proud Korean War vet, and must have been a tough guy, who would have commanded my unconditional respect fron a strap if it came to that.

Accordingly, if you are a Jewish male, age 48 on up, and are a traditional, old-school Jewish father figure or father, or believe you can fill that role on an ongoing basis, either once a week or once every two weeks, in sessions, please write with your age, stats, general location, experience, and your ability to host the sessions.

I know this is quite a lot to ask of one person, but if you feel you fit this bill, write me as I've requested above.

title: I get it. I really do.
text:
You've got questions.

Serious questions.

SUPER serious questions.

"What happened to a sense of wonder?"

"How do I rectify the natural human urge to make the world a better place with the reality of ultimately meaningless natural human obsessions?"

"What do I do when I realize being a grown up kind of sucks?"

"Where does this ennui come from?"

"Why is ennui such a funny word? It sounds like what a toddler would call his penis, an in-wee"

"Oh shit. Please stop thinking about that. The private parts of toddlers is never something that should be thought about, unless you're a pediatric urologist "

"Is pediatric urology a real field? Or are they just pediatricians or urologists?"

Yes, we all have questions. Just hopefully not about pediatric urology.

Oh, and I guess a Craigslist post would not be complete without a cock pic, so here you go:

title: Words of encouragement
text:
Recently I realized I want a career in law enforcement... :) Its so discouraging when I have friends or current co-workers ask about what I want in the future, I tell them that I'm working on getting into shape to go to the police academy and if I'm not getting a dirty look, I get a one word responses, or how much they hate this or hate that. I think it's pretty sad to see so many young people not even encouraging others who want to better a community they've been apart of their whole life, to make their world or maybe even their future kid's community a more safe place. Instead I get backlash.



I feel like I should just keep it a secret, but at the same time I'm so proud of myself for getting this far, getting over the intimidation of all the what ifs and working towards something so great. 



I guest I'm just looking for like minded people or a few words of encouragement, its always nice to read some supporting words while I'm working hard towards something so big.

title: Seeking Interesting Company
text:
Hi, 

I'm the weirdest person you'll meet or you may 'get' me a little and then you'll maybe know more later on because I'm not shy at all but I'm quiet a lot of the time. 

I want to stay with someone who is positive, healthy, happy and peaceful. Non-judgemental is the only way because I'm not comfortable around people who have ideas about the way things 'should' be. I'm 28, Caucasian, tattooed, fit and healthy. I don't do drugs, smoke, drink. If you smoke 420 it's not an issue unless it's common. I like balance in an environment. 

Okay so you're probably wondering what I want and why I think it'll work out. I like adventures and experiences because I am studying runes (an ancient alphabet) while traveling randomly and meeting people of all sorts. It's like my own hobbit journey sort of, an epic journey. It's dangerous on craigslist doing this, and lots of people have told me I'm really crazy or they feel bad for me. I like what I'm doing and I'm very, very happy. 

If you have extra room and wouldn't mind having me around I would love to stay with you for a week. I have no money and I'll provide my own food of course and toiletries. 

I meditate in the mornings and study. After I go out into nature or do an odd job. Some times depending on where I'm staying I meet with friends who share similar interests. 

If you aren't spiritual or you think what I do isn't real or worth my time, it's okay. I know exactly what my goals are. Please please please don't assume I'm in trouble, need advice, a job, or anything. If you WANT to shelter a stranger for a week, awesome. 

Please be under 35.

title: FRENCH Certified PERSONAL TRAINER For Hire (Los Angeles)
text:
Bonjour! My name is Williams, I M A STRAIGHT PERSON AT 100%.
I am a certified personal trainer with 8 years of fitness experience in nutrition, training, sports and athleticism. I'm also a French international model signed to Wilhelmina Models LA, so staying healthy both physically and mentally has always been a strong part of my daily life.

I would like to utilise my expertise to help you set and achieve your fitness goals in order to better yourself - the way you look, the way you feel and the way you continue to live. Together, we will develop a workout routine that best suits your needs and then go from there...

I am a member of LA Fitness, so if you are too, we can easily have our sessions at this particular gym. However, if you have your own private gym or I will be more than happy to travel to your place I have all the stuff in my car to workout.

About MY RATE :
- is $80 for 1 session by each week and each session is 1h to 1.5 hours up to my clients :-)
- is $150 for 2 sessions by each week meaning $75 for each session
- is $200 for 3 sessions by each week meaning $66 for each session
- is $240 for 4 sessions by each week meaning $60 for each session
- is $280 for 5 sessions by each week meaning $56 for each session
My schedule is pretty flexible, so I can be available at your request for as many sessions as your fitness goals require.

If you are interested in my personal training services, please feel free to e-mail me with your contact information and I will be sure to respond as soon as possible. Serious inquiries only. I really look forward to working with you!

title: Do you think having matching credit ratings are important?
text:
I was listening the radio the other day and the host was saying of all the numbers in numerology
The number that might be the best compatibility predictor is your credit rating.

If you think about it...a credit rating certainly does say something for character.
Would you trust your life to someone with 550 credit rating over someone with a 750 rating?
In my life I've come to see people are a lot like their credit rating.
If you know how your credit number is compiled then you know...you don't have to have a lot of money to have great credit.

That being said...if your credit rating is north of 700
My guess is your a responsible person and someone I might like to meet.
I'm a good man, love the out doors, love being creative, I'm easy going and always up for a laugh
Looking to meet a cool, responsible new friend?
Don't be shy...say hi and include a pic

Have a fun day!

title: Looking for a hiking partner, maybe open to more
text:
I know this is a long shot, but honest abe didn't succeed in his first shot either.

I met this girl via craigslist. she had replied to a posting I had posted in casual encounters about me performing oral sex on her. We exchanged pictures, and sort of hit it off. We didn't end up meeting, but we talked, texted, and made intentions of being friends...Turned out she was a very outdoorsy kind of girl...like literally hiking everyday... as couple days transpired, she always talked about us getting together, hanging out, going hiking, and doing things together. However, "things" kept coming up, and she kind of ended up just blowing me off and shooting down the plans we would make.... It got to the point where she just ghosted me completely. This happened a couple of weeks ago... but I just haven't been able to shake this from my psyche.

It's not the fact we didn't hook up, but she projected herself as this sweet person, to only act and behave counterpoint to what she was portraying...I think that bothered me the most.

This weird experience created a couple of desires and unfulfilled wants in my mind. Where I am hoping that maybe...just maybe there is somebody out there...

That already goes hiking, or wants to --- but doesn't have a buddy to go hiking with --- or that their hiking buddy no longer really goes hiking with them. If we hit it off, I would be open to a more deeper and intimate connection.... if it doesn't pan out, at least we tried.

I would also like this moment to disclose that I am physically handicapped as well. As circumstances would have it, i was born without an arm, and leg, but I don't let that impair my mobility and enthusiasm for being an active person. I write this tidbit, so if you do decide to reply, you know about this going in, and aren't surprised later and feel I might have deceived you or this isn't what you wanted.

about me: fairly well educated, masculine guy, hairy with facial hair that i keep groomed/trimmed. deep voice, i'm about 6'1 feet tall and about 180 pounds. I enjoy a fine craft beer from time to time. 4:20 friendly, but its not a compulsory must...i don't want it to be the focal point of this post. No drugs, no stds, clean bill of health. Currently I am single, dating, but haven't quite met someone I can synergyze well with.

If you are seriously interested, please reply with your picture, age, location. A number would speed up this process and weed out the people that aren't serious.

text:
Friends first; lets get to know each other!!

As to what I like to do the laundry list can go on and on, but will try almost anything once. Someone who has feelings and is not afraid to express then, help each other out in both times of good and bad.I don't care what you do fore work or where you live or what you drive, just be a good hearted and a real person that hard to find this city we call home.
